page.title: 10LANDSCAPE/BUILDINGS,OASTS.
page.content: The original{Oast Houses}were square, Brick-built Kilns used for drying Hops These were superseeded in the 19th Century, by the more familiar round shape,with conical roof and a distinc- tive White wooden cowl, which is so much part of the Kentish scene. The Hop fields have given way to other Agricultural uses, but the Oasts have taken on a new lease of life.It is not a new idea for Oasts to be used as living quarters,but in recent years a great number have been considerably renovated into valuable property. Now fitted with windows,modern plumbing and electricity,many humble Oasthouses are the latest "Desirable Residences" in Kent. Planning permission is allowed so long as the exterior shape remains in the original style.
